chapter.title: Templates
chapter.para:
The template specific elements which may be contained in the template description are as follows:
type One of DESKTOP or SERVER
status One of ILLEGAL, LOCKED or OK
creation_time The date and time at which this template was created, using the xsd:dateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss
origin The system from which this template originated. One of RHEV, VMWARE or XEN
stateless Boolean value specifying whether or not the template is stateless. A stateless template has a snapshot of its disk image taken at boot and deleted at shutdown, meaning state changes will not persist after a reboot. One of true or false.
memory The amount of memory allocated to the guest, in bytes
cpu The CPU topology (i.e. number of sockets and cores) available to the guest
os boot dev="cdrom|hd|network" A list of boot devices (described by a dev attribute on a boot element) - either cdrom, hd or network
os kernel A path to a kernel image which the template is configured to boot from
os initrd A path to an initrd image to be used with the kernel above
os cmdline A kernel command line parameter string to be used with the kernel above
cluster A reference to the cluster on which an instance of this template will run. See
vm A reference to the VM on which this template is based. See
For example:
chapter.screen: <template id="00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000" href="/rhevm-api/templates/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"> <name>Blank</name> <description>Blank template</description> <type>SERVER</type> <status>OK</status> <creation_time>2010-08-16T14:24:29</creation_time> <stateless>false</stateless> <origin>RHEV</origin> <memory>536870912</memory> <cpu> <topology cores="1" sockets="1"/> </cpu> <os> <boot dev="hd"/> </os> <cluster id="99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95" href="/rhevm-api/clusters/99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95"/> <actions> <link rel="export" href="/rhevm-api/templates/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/export"/> </actions> </template>
chapter.para: When creating a new template, the name and vm id elements are required. The name, description, type, memory, cpu topology, os boot dev and stateless properties may be updated post-creation.
Templates also have a number of read-only device collections through which the devices attached to template may be queried. Like with VMs, there are cdroms, disks and nics collections. See .
There are two possible actions for templates - export and import.

section.title: Export Action
section.para: Export a template to an Export storage domain. A destination storage domain must be specified with a storage_domain reference. By default, the export action will overwrite any existing template by the same name in the destination domain, but this may be avoided by setting the exclusive parameter to true.

section.title: Import Action
section.para: Import a template from an Export storage domain. The destination cluster and storage domain must be specified via cluster and storage_domain references.

note.para: The import action is only available on templates listed under an Export storage domain. See .
